segments.text: I observe a boy precariously perched on a stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a rush of anxiety watching him stretch so far.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His tiny hand is almost in the jar, and I feel my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he tips over? It would be such a disaster!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I see the excitement in his eyes, and part of me wants to cheer him on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Cookies are calling his name, and I remember how irresistible they can be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But he’s not thinking about the consequences, and that worries me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I glance back at the woman, completely oblivious to this impending calamity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in a bubble where everything is fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Each second that passes feels like it could end in chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
